channel.title: Charlie Stross / @cstross
channel.description: Twitter feed for: @cstross. Generated by nitter.42l.fr

item.title: R to @Exceliton: I don't think the UK publisher ever recorded and released an audiobook edition. In the USA, it was released on CD by Recorded Books. (It came out in 2009, so predates the big boom in online downloadable audiobooks.)
item.dc:creator: @cstross
item.description: I don't think the UK publisher ever recorded and released an audiobook edition. In the USA, it was released on CD by Recorded Books. (It came out in 2009, so predates the big boom in online downloadable audiobooks.)

item.title: RT by @cstross: CLIVE LEWIS MP 'the Scottish people have 2 clear choices: 1. Union with a declining imperial power, ruled by hard-right, neoliberal English nationalists, or 2. Vote for Scottish independence & look to rejoin the EU, an emerging power with democratic institutions gaining in power'
item.dc:creator: @Celebs4indy
item.description:
CLIVE LEWIS MP 'the Scottish people have 2 clear choices:
1. Union with a declining imperial power, ruled by hard-right, neoliberal English nationalists, or
2. Vote for Scottish independence & look to rejoin the EU, an emerging power with democratic institutions gaining in power'

item.title: RT by @cstross: Why is it English people never look at Scotland to learn from what we're doing? I admire Femi, but he is just as typically English as any other England-based pundit. Scotland has PR, different types of PR in council & in parliamentary elections. 🧵
item.dc:creator: @EyeEdinburgh
item.description:
Why is it English people never look at Scotland to learn from what we're doing?
I admire Femi, but he is just as typically English as any other England-based pundit.
Scotland has PR, different types of PR in council & in parliamentary elections. 🧵

item.title: RT by @cstross: my favourite part of any scam unravelling: everybody getting busted by an agency nobody remembers has enforcement powers. getting your door kicked in by the Charity Commission tactical team
item.dc:creator: @AliceAvizandum
item.description:

item.title: R to @LianaBrooks: I don't gamble, but if I did, I'd be betting on her making it as Prime Minister some time before 2032 (possibly as early as 2023). Shudder.
item.dc:creator: @cstross
item.description: I don't gamble, but if I did, I'd be betting on her making it as Prime Minister some time before 2032 (possibly as early as 2023). Shudder.

item.title: R to @LianaBrooks: I have a real problem at present trying to make the New Management remotely as scary as Priti Patel (nb: wiki doesn 't mention that her former PR firm employers ran campaigns for the tobacco industry—if anything her wikipedia entry is very understated): https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Priti_Patel
item.dc:creator: @cstross

item.title: R to @LianaBrooks: I'm afraid I've found that Cthulhu just isn't scary enough these days.
item.dc:creator: @cstross
item.description: I'm afraid I've found that Cthulhu just isn't scary enough these days.

item.title: R to @schaptal: If you get to the afterlife and find it's running DOS, then clearly you're in hell.
item.dc:creator: @cstross
item.description: If you get to the afterlife and find it's running DOS, then clearly you're in hell.

item.title: RT by @cstross: Christians ... what if you die and you find out it is all real? Cthulhu dreaming in his palace in sunken R'lyeh, monstrous Azathoth gnawing souls at the heart of the cosmos to the muffled, madding beat of gigantic drums and the thin, monotonous whine of accursed flutes—what then?
item.dc:creator: @cstross
item.description:
Christians ... what if you die and you find out it is all real? Cthulhu dreaming in his palace in sunken R'lyeh, monstrous Azathoth gnawing souls at the heart of the cosmos to the muffled, madding beat of gigantic drums and the thin, monotonous whine of accursed flutes—what then?

nitter.42l.fr/dh4onethingonly/status/1541617804855631873#m

item.title:
RT by @cstross: Just to remind people for the weekend.
There's a young couple - young trendy black woman, bearded white guy - who try and get you to do vox pops and pretend to be allies starting a new website. Their questions gradually get dodgy. They're actually far right.
Do not engage.
item.dc:creator: @RozKaveney
item.description:
Just to remind people for the weekend.

There's a young couple - young trendy black woman, bearded white guy - who try and get you to do vox pops and pretend to be allies starting a new website. Their questions gradually get dodgy. They're actually far right.

Do not engage.

item.title:
RT by @cstross: NTA. Also, your husband is a hero. May he yodel long & loudly every time your MIL mentions the baby topic. Every. Single. Time.
Yodel-oh-ee-dee Diddly-odel-oh-ee-dee Diddly-odel-oh-ee-dee Yodel-oh-ee-dee-ay-dee Yodel-oh-ee-dee-yodel-oh-dee
item.dc:creator: @EyeEdinburgh
item.description:
NTA. Also, your husband is a hero. May he yodel long & loudly every time your MIL mentions the baby topic. Every. Single. Time.

Yodel-oh-ee-dee
Diddly-odel-oh-ee-dee
Diddly-odel-oh-ee-dee
Yodel-oh-ee-dee-ay-dee
Yodel-oh-ee-dee-yodel-oh-dee

item.title: R to @zeri42: Yeah, it's on my list of story ideas I'll never get round to: a steampunk alt where the thermodynamics make sense because it's use nuclear power as the prime mover (with Victorian attitudes to health and safety, i.e. "ban abortions: we need more child labour, they die too fast").
item.dc:creator: @cstross
item.description: Yeah, it's on my list of story ideas I'll never get round to: a steampunk alt where the thermodynamics make sense because it's use nuclear power as the prime mover (with Victorian attitudes to health and safety, i.e. "ban abortions: we need more child labour, they die too fast").

item.title: R to @sirlanda: Ahem: because you asked? Last week's news: Spanish airline reserves 10 Airlander airships from Bedford-based firm https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-beds-bucks-herts-61811535
item.dc:creator: @cstross
item.description: Ahem: because you asked? Last week's news: Spanish airline reserves 10 Airlander airships from Bedford-based firm bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-be…

item.title: R to @Salty_NZ: Yes, but on the other hand 48 hours by 747 is enough time to circle the entire planet. Finding a surviving airport to land on, even after WW3, shouldn't be impossible. (Taking off again might be harder—it'll probably be in a neutral state.)
item.dc:creator: @cstross
item.description: Yes, but on the other hand 48 hours by 747 is enough time to circle the entire planet. Finding a surviving airport to land on, even after WW3, shouldn't be impossible. (Taking off again might be harder—it'll probably be in a neutral state.)

item.title: R to @feyhunde: A 747-400 has 7 toilets. A 747 has an empty weight of burns roughly 1kg of fuel per kg of hull weight per 13,000km flown (roughly 1 day). So shaving just 1kg off the weight of a toilet means saving roughly 2 tons of fuel per year per plane or 1400 tons across the 700-plane fleet.
item.dc:creator: @cstross
item.description: A 747-400 has 7 toilets. A 747 has an empty weight of burns roughly 1kg of fuel per kg of hull weight per 13,000km flown (roughly 1 day). So shaving just 1kg off the weight of a toilet means saving roughly 2 tons of fuel per year per plane or 1400 tons across the 700-plane fleet.

item.title: RT by @cstross: This old concept I made 11 years ago when I worked at grasshopper manufacture got world wide viral after a youtube video (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZrodDBJdGuo&ab_channel=HashemAl-Ghaili) was made about the whole idea (I gave permission). Shown on a bunch of TV shows & news sites. Weird how social media works.🤷‍♂️
item.dc:creator: @TonyHolmsten
item.description: This old concept I made 11 years ago when I worked at grasshopper manufacture got world wide viral after a youtube video (invidious.fdn.fr/watch?v=ZrodDBJd…) was made about the whole idea (I gave permission). Shown on a bunch of TV shows & news sites. Weird how social media works.🤷‍♂️

item.title: R to @SvenGeier: For evidence that with enough thrust pigs can fly, look at the belly on this porker: yes it could hit 1500mph, but it had a supersonic intercept range of only 155 miles because it drank like a fish.
item.dc:creator: @cstross
item.description: For evidence that with enough thrust pigs can fly, look at the belly on this porker: yes it could hit 1500mph, but it had a supersonic intercept range of only 155 miles because it drank like a fish.

item.title:
RT by @cstross: This man has recently been failed by negligent lawyers. And short of a miracle the only thing standing between him and near-certain death is the pressure we can apply to the @ukhomeoffice and the Nigerian High Commissioner this evening.
@stonewalluk @rainbowmigrants 2/
item.dc:creator: @BellaSankey
item.description:
This man has recently been failed by negligent lawyers. And short of a miracle the only thing standing between him and near-certain death is the pressure we can apply to the @ukhomeoffice and the Nigerian High Commissioner this evening.

@stonewalluk @rainbowmigrants 2/
